content:
That's wonderful! It's great to hear that reading during your commute has become a beneficial ritual for you. Getting lost in a good book can be so immersive that it's easy to lose track of time, and it's hilarious that you've almost missed your stop a few times!

I love that you mentioned that reading helps you prepare for the day ahead. It's amazing how something as simple as reading can have a profound impact on our mental state and productivity. By clearing your mind and getting focused, you're setting yourself up for a more productive and successful day.

Reading can be a great way to calm the mind and reduce stress, and it's fantastic that you've found a way to incorporate it into your daily routine. It's almost like a form of meditation, but with the added benefit of being entertained and engaged at the same time!

Do you find that you're more productive or efficient during the day when you've had a chance to read during your commute, or is it more about the mental clarity and focus you mentioned earlier?

Also, have you ever had any interesting or notable experiences while reading during your commute, such as striking up a conversation with a fellow reader or discovering a new author?
